title: Spectral-Bias and Kernel-Task Alignment in Physically Informed Neural Networks. (arXiv:2307.06362v1 [stat.ML])
abstract: Physically informed neural networks (PINNs) are a promising emerging method for solving differential equations. As in many other deep learning approaches, the choice of PINN design and training protocol requires careful craftsmanship. Here, we suggest a comprehensive theoretical framework that sheds light on this important problem. Leveraging an equivalence between infinitely over-parameterized neural networks and Gaussian process regression (GPR), we derive an integro-differential equation that governs PINN prediction in the large data-set limit -- the Neurally-Informed Equation (NIE). This equation augments the original one by a kernel term reflecting architecture choices and allows quantifying implicit bias induced by the network via a spectral decomposition of the source term in the original differential equation.

translated_title: 具有谱偏差和内核-任务对齐的物理信息神经网络
translated_abstract: 物理信息神经网络（PINN）是解决微分方程的一种有前景的新方法。与许多其他深度学习方法一样，PINN的设计和训练协议的选择需要精心制定。在这里，我们提出了一个综合的理论框架，对这个重要问题进行了阐述。通过利用超参数化神经网络和高斯过程回归（GPR）之间的等价性，我们推导出一种在大数据集限制下决定PINN预测的积分微分方程——神经信息方程（NIE）。该方程通过反映架构选择的内核项来补充原始方程，并通过原始微分方程中源项的谱分解来量化网络引入的隐含偏差。
tldr: 本文提出了一个综合的理论框架，解决了物理信息神经网络（PINN）设计和训练协议的选择问题。通过将超参数化神经网络和高斯过程回归等价起来，推导出了一种在大数据集限制下决定PINN预测的积分微分方程，以及通过原始微分方程中源项的谱分解来量化网络引入的隐含偏差。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a comprehensive theoretical framework for addressing the design and training protocol selection in physically informed neural networks (PINNs). By leveraging an equivalence between over-parameterized neural networks and Gaussian process regression, the authors derive an integro-differential equation that governs PINN prediction in the large data-set limit and quantify the implicit bias induced by the network through a spectral decomposition of the source term in the original differential equation.
